alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 4:16PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following counties, Coffee and Geneva. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Enterprise, Samson, Kinston, Coffee Springs, Marvin Chapel, Spears, Lucile, Goodman, Sellersville, Central City, Chancellor, Battens Crossroads, Enterprise Municipal A/P, Holley Store, Pera, Ino, Weeks, Cool Springs, Alberton and Keyton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
